poi.poiDescription:
Born 1759; died 1851 ; age 87.

Dr. DeMarle raises the question whether Eliot (or Elliot) Bartlett is recognized as a
Revolutionary War Veteran (Vermont Militia).

“Bartlett: Significantly there is very strong evidence pointing to the fact that Eliott Bartlett
served in the Revolutionary war, or to state it another way, that the Eliott Bartlett who served in
the revolutionary war, is the Eliott Bartlett who is in the Rapids cemetery.”

Son: Orange Bartlett Born Dec. 16, 1789 in Vermont - (mother: Abigail).
Died in Gates, NY Jan. 6, 1847.

Daughter: Hannah Rose Bartlett (1818 -1902); born in Mass.
Son of Cyrus W. & Sara (second wife?); born 1829; died Aug.3, 1830; age 11 months

- daughter of Truman & Charlotte; born 1837; died Jan. 25, 1862 ; age 25

2-piece restorable Headstone (unearthed 2017)
poi.inscription:
EMLY (sic) A.
daughter of Truman & Charlotte. HULIN
Died January 25, 1862 /. Age 25 yrs; 4 months & 18(?) days
(a 4-line epitaph is unreadable)

locations.hl_desc: Susan B. Anthony House, in Rochester, New York, was the home of Susan B. Anthony for forty years, while she was a national figure in the women's rights movement. She was arrested in the front parlor after attempting to vote in the 1872 Presidential Election. She resided here until her death.

Come and explore history in downtown Rochester on The Heritage Trail, a 1.25-mile long walking path that leads visitors to 15 points of historical significance. This self-guided tour follows an 8” wide line of either granite or blue paint on city sidewalks, along the way visitors will find historical markers, plaques, and interpretive signs telling some of the stories that make up Rochester’s rich history.

The Canalway Trail offers hundreds of miles of scenic trails and numerous parks for walking, bicycling, cross country skiing, and other recreational activities.  This trail parallels the New York State Canal System, comprised of four historic waterways: the Erie, the Champlain, the Oswego, and the Cayuga-Seneca Canals.  The Canal System spans 524 miles across the Hudson River with Lake Champlain, Lake Ontario, the Finger Lakes, the Niagara River, and Lake Erie.
Civil War recruit training camp; - regiments served in over 20 major battles; turned tide at Gettysburg
1868-1932; distillation refinery (leather conditioners and illumination gas) [Energy: lubricants & fuel that made internal combustion engine patentable]
